metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 30 axioms covering threat situations, threat detection, risk bias, concern, and seriousness evaluation
metadata.notation: First-order logic with envisioned causal systems, temporal reasoning, and composite scales

axioms.title: Definition of threatSituation
axioms.fol: (forall (s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (iff (threatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (exists (s1 e3) (and (ecs s a)(member e0 s1)(eventualitiesOf s1 s) (causallyInvolved e0 e)(branch e e1 e2 s) (imply e1 e3)(not' e3 g)(goal g a) (not (imply e2 e3))))))
axioms.english: s is a threat situation for agent a with respect to situation e0, involving an envisioned branch e to alternatives e1 and e2, where one alternative e1 leads to the negation of a goal g and the other e2 does not

axioms.title: Definition of threat in situation
axioms.fol: (forall (s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (if (threatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g)(threat e1 a s)))
axioms.english: e1 is the threat to agent a in situation s

axioms.title: Definition of threat0
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 a) (iff (threat0 e1 a)(exists (s)(threat e1 a s))))
axioms.english: e1 is a threat to a in some threat situation

axioms.title: Definition of goalInThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (if (threatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g)(goalInThreat g a s)))
axioms.english: g is the goal of a's that is threatened by situation s

axioms.title: Definition of threatCondition
axioms.fol: (forall (s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (if (threatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (threatCondition e a s)))
axioms.english: The envisioned branch point e is the threat condition

axioms.title: Definition of realThreatSituation
axioms.fol: (forall (s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (iff (realThreatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (and (threatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g)(cwu s a) (Rexist e0))))
axioms.english: A threat situation is real if the envisioned causal system is the current world understanding and the anchor e0 really exists

axioms.title: Definition of possibleThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 a c) (iff (possibleThreat e1 a c) (exists (s e0 e e2 g) (and (realThreatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (possible e1 c)))))
axioms.english: A possible threat arises in a real threat situation where the threat e1 is possible with respect to constraints c

axioms.title: Definition of impossibleThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 a c) (iff (impossibleThreat e1 a c) (exists (s e0 e e2 g) (and (realThreatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (not (possible e1 c))))))
axioms.english: An impossible threat arises in a real threat situation where the threat e1 is impossible with respect to constraints c

axioms.title: Definition of realizedThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 a) (iff (realizedThreat e1 a) (exists (s a e0 e e2 g e3 t1 t2) (and (realThreatSituation' e3 s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (atTime e3 t1)(atTime e1 t2)(before t1 t2)))))
axioms.english: A threat is realized if there was a threat situation at time t1 and the threat e1 actually occurred at a later time t2

axioms.title: Definition of unrealizedThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 a) (iff (unrealizedThreat e1 a) (exists (s a e0 e e2 g e3 t1) (and (realThreatSituation' e3 s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (atTime e3 t1) (not (exists (t2) (and (atTime e1 t2)(before t1 t2))))))))
axioms.english: A threat is unrealized if there is no subsequent time t2 at which the threat actually occurs

axioms.title: Definition of threatDetection
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s a) (iff (threatDetection s1 s a) (exists (e0 e e1 e2 g) (and (ecsSeq s1 a)(last s s1) (threatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g)))))
axioms.english: s1 is the process of detecting threat situation s by agent a through an envisioning sequence

axioms.title: Threat detection ability
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (s1 s c) (and (able a s1 c)(threatDetection s1 s a)))))
axioms.english: People have an ability to detect threats

axioms.title: Definition of threatDetectionFailure
axioms.fol: (forall (a s1 s) (iff (threatDetectionFailure a s1 s) (and (fail a s1)(threatDetection s1 s a))))
axioms.english: People can fail to identify a threat

axioms.title: Definition of concern
axioms.fol: (forall (x a) (iff (concern x a) (exists (e3 e1 c) (and (believe a e3)(possibleThreat' e3 e1 a c) (arg* x e1)))))
axioms.english: To be concerned about something x is to believe there is a possible threat e1 involving x

axioms.title: Definition of biasAgainstRisk
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (iff (biasAgainstRisk a) (forall (e3 s e0 e e1 e2 g) (if (and (threatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (concern' e3 e1 a)(agentOf a e0)) (exists (e4 e5 c) (and (likely e4 c)(cwu c a)(cause' e4 e3 e5) (not' e5 e0)))))))
axioms.english: Agent a has a bias against risk if concerns about threats likely cause a to refrain from risky actions

axioms.title: Definition of biasTowardRisk
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (iff (biasTowardRisk a) (forall (e3 s e0 e e1 e2 g) (if (and (threatSituation s a e0 e e1 e2 g) (concern' e3 e1 a)(agentOf a e0)) (exists (e4 e5 c) (and (not (likely e4 c))(cwu c a) (cause' e4 e3 e5)(not' e5 e0)))))))
axioms.english: Agent a has a bias toward risk if concerns about threats are not likely to cause a to refrain from risky actions

axioms.title: Definition of addThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1) (iff (addThreat a e1) (exists (e3) (and (changeTo e3)(concern' e3 e1 a)))))
axioms.english: When threats are identified, they are added to those that the agent is concerned with

axioms.title: Definition of removeThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1) (iff (removeThreat a e1) (exists (e3) (and (changeFrom e3)(concern' e3 e1 a)))))
axioms.english: When threats are no longer a concern, they are removed

axioms.title: Definition of seriousnessScale
axioms.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (seriousnessScale s a) (exists (s1 s2) (and (likelihoodScale s1)(importanceScale s2 a) (compositeScale s s1 s2) (forall (e1 x) (if (at e1 x s)(threat0 e1 a)))))))
axioms.english: The seriousness scale is a composite of likelihood and importance scales, with threats as elements

axioms.title: Definition of moreSerious'
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 a) (iff (moreSerious' e e1 e2 a) (exists (s s1) (and (seriousnessScale s a)(scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)))))
axioms.english: e is the eventuality of one threat e1 being more serious than threat e2 to agent a

axioms.title: Definition of serious'
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 a) (iff (serious' e e1 a) (exists (s) (and (seriousnessScale s a)(scaleFor s e)))))
axioms.english: e is the eventuality of threat e1 being serious to agent a (in the Hi region of the scale)

axioms.title: Definition of seriousness
axioms.fol: (forall (x e1 a) (iff (seriousness x e1 a) (exists (s) (and (seriousnessScale s a)(at e1 x s)))))
axioms.english: x is the seriousness measure of threat e1 to agent a (its place in the scale)

axioms.title: Definition of assessThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1) (iff (assessThreat a e1) (exists (x e3 e4 d) (and (try a e3)(changeTo' e3 e4)(know' e4 a d) (seriousness' d x e1 a)))))
axioms.english: To assess a threat is to try to come to know the seriousness of the threat

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Uses 11 primed predicates: not', realThreatSituation', possibleThreat', concern', cause', changeTo', changeFrom', know', moreSerious', serious', seriousness'
conversion_notes.temporal_reasoning: Extensive temporal framework with atTime and before predicates for threat realization
conversion_notes.envisioned_causal_systems: Heavy integration with ECS framework through ecs, ecsSeq, causallyInvolved, branch predicates
conversion_notes.scale_integration: Sophisticated composite scale theory combining likelihood and importance for seriousness evaluation
conversion_notes.modal_concepts: Real vs possible vs impossible threat distinctions using constraints and possibility predicates
conversion_notes.no_defeasible_reasoning: Chapter contains no axioms with (etc) conditions - focuses on precise threat definitions
conversion_notes.cross_references: Builds on eventualities (Ch 5), scales (Ch 12), causality (Ch 15), persons (Ch 19), modality (Ch 20), belief (Ch 21), envisioning (Ch 24), goals (Ch 28)

file_format_notes.extraction_source: Chapter 30: Threats and Threat Detection from Gordon & Hobbs (2017)
file_format_notes.logical_operators: Standard FOL with forall, exists, if, iff, and, or, not operators
file_format_notes.predicate_conventions: Primed predicates indicate reified eventualities, threat0 indicates existential generalization
file_format_notes.variable_conventions: Standard variable naming (a for agents, e/e1/e2/e3 for eventualities, s for situations/scales, x for positions, t for times, c for constraints, g for goals)
file_format_notes.complexity_criteria: Simple: direct implications, basic constraints; Moderate: existential quantification, moderate structure; Complex: nested quantifiers, sophisticated logical structure
